title: Album Page, "Water Tower, Hoorn", August 23, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: recto, in graphite, upper right: Water Tower - Hoorn / August 23rd 1887 / Built 1532-1651; (inscribed in circle): 23; 27.
description: Vertical sheet depicting a large, eclectically adorned masonry Romanesque structure with later additions.  The building's main elevation terminates in a corner, while the rest of the building is rounded toward the rear.  Very small timber-frame structures are seen in the foreground.  The building's character is in keeping with the Northern Renaissance style: it has a steeply pitched roof culminating in a large, four-sided clocktower with a galleried, octagonal double cupola and tall ornamental finial.  The façade's lower elevation consists of a row of blind trefoils, a row of small windows above, and another small blind arcade before the attic story.  There are turrets at the façade corners, and another in the center of the façade upon which sits a unicorn bearing the arms of the town of Hoorn.  A date plaque above reads 1532-1651 in a banner.  Visible at the rear of the building is a rounded façade with blind arcade.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Water Tower, Hoorn", August 23, 1887.
August 23, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-105.
